smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'SettingsActivity' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: FunctionMinLength
smells.description: Function names should not be shorter than the minimum defined in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at least 3 characters long.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class object. This might result in confusion. Please rename the member.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: context.getSystemService(Context.LOCATION_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to LocationManager.
context.getSystemService(Context.POWER_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to PowerManager.
findViewById(R.id.toolbar) cannot be safely cast to Toolbar?.
unit cannot be safely cast to Unit.
valueAnimator!!.animatedValue cannot be safely cast to Float.
context.getSystemService(Context.NOTIFICATION_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to NotificationManager.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Settings defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: NewLineAtEndOfFile
smells.description: Checks whether files end with a line separator.

The file BaseActivity.kt is not ending with a new line.

smells.name: MaxLineLength
smells.description: Line detected that is longer than the defined maximum line length in the code style.

instances.message: Line detected that is longer than the defined maximum line length in the code style.
Line detected that is longer than the defined maximum line length in the code style.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function deserializeUnit defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.
Optional braces in when expression
Optional braces in when expression
Optional braces in when expression

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: ch.rmy.android.statusbar_tacho.utils.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (openAngle / 2) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: openAngle / 2
Parentheses in (availableHeight / aspectRatio) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: availableHeight / aspectRatio
Parentheses in (markCount - 1) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: markCount - 1
